intro: Synaedrys sericea, commonly known as silky synaedrys, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that are covered in a fine, silky layer of white hairs. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Synaedrys sericea is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils.
